etymologies: modern Latin, perhaps from Latin monstrum ‘monster’ (because of the unusual appearance of the leaves in some species)

definitions: a large tropical American climbing plant of the arum family, which typically has divided or perforated leaves and corky aerial roots. Several kinds are cultivated as indoor plants when young.

notes.text: Genus Monstera, family Araceae: several species

shortDefinitions: large tropical American climbing plant of arum family
